ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Then their Reckoning is Our concern.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Ours is surely then to reckon with them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and then it is for Us to call them to account.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: In Our hands are their accounts.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then indeed only upon Us is their reckoning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then verily, for Us will be their reckoning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then surely upon Us is the taking of their account.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: then upon Us shall rest their reckoning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then, surely, it is for Us to call them to account.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then verily on us is their reckoning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Then, indeed, their reckoning will lie with Us.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then it will be for Us to call them to account.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then verily, for Us will be their reckoning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: then upon Us shall rest their reckoning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then upon Us rests their reckoning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then indeed, upon Us is their account.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [88:26] then truly with Us will lie their reckoning, their requital, which We will never abandon.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And Ours their reckoning) their steadfastness in the life of the world and reward and punishment in the Hereafter'. And of the surah in which the Dawn is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 29 verses, 139 words and 597 letters: Surah 89: The Dawn (al-Fajr) And of the surah in which the Dawn is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 29 verses, 139 words and 597 letters:
